com.wedeploy.android

Class WeDeployData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wedeploy.android.BaseWeDeployService<WeDeployData>
      • com.wedeploy.android.WeDeployData

  • public class WeDeployData
extends BaseWeDeployService<WeDeployData>
    The WeDeployData service enables you to store data securely to a NoSQL cloud database, make complex queries instantly, and consume information in real-time.

    This class is not thread safe. In order to avoid concurrency issues, you must create a new instance by calling WeDeploy.data(String) for every request you want to do on WeDeployData.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.wedeploy.android.BaseWeDeployService

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public Call<Response> create(java.lang.String collection,
                             JSONArray data)
        Creates multiple objects and saves them to WeDeploy data. If there's a validation registered in the collection and the request is successful, the array of objects is returned. The data JSONArray describes the attributes on the objects that are to be created. 

        
 WeDeployData data = weDeploy.data("http://demodata.wedeploy.io");

 JSONObject movie1JsonObject = new JSONObject()
      .put("title", "Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones");

 JSONObject movie2JsonObject = new JSONObject()
      .put("title", "Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith");

 JSONArray dataJsonArray = new JSONArray()
      .put(movie1JsonObject)
      .put(movie2JsonObject);

 response = weDeploy.data(DATA_URL)
      .create("movies", moviesJsonArray)
      .execute();
        Parameters:
        collection - Collection (key) used to create the new data.
        data - Attributes on the object that is to be created.
        Returns:
        Call

      • create

        public Call<Response> create(java.lang.String collection,
                             JSONObject data)
        Creates an object and saves it to WeDeploy data. If there's a validation registered in the collection and the request is successful, the object is returned. The data JSONObject describes the attributes on the objects that are to be created. 

        
 WeDeployData data = weDeploy.data("http://demodata.wedeploy.io");

 JSONObject movieJsonObject = new JSONObject()
      .put("title", "Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones");

 response = weDeploy.data(DATA_URL)
      .create("movies", movieJsonObject)
      .execute();
        Parameters:
        collection - Collection (key) used to create the new data.
        data - Attributes on the object that is to be created.
        Returns:
        Call

      • createCollection

        public Call<Response> createCollection(java.lang.String name,
                                       CollectionFieldMap mapping)
        Creates a collection and maps the field types. The data CollectionFieldMap contains the field names and their types CollectionFieldType. The mapping can also contains nested CollectionFieldMap. 

        
 WeDeployData data = weDeploy.data("http://demodata.wedeploy.io");

 CollectionFieldMap genreFieldTypeMap = new CollectionFieldMap();
 innerCollection.put("name", CollectionFieldType.STRING);
 innerCollection.put("description", CollectionFieldType.STRING);

 CollectionFieldMap movieMap = new CollectionFieldMap();
 mapping.put("title", CollectionFieldType.STRING);
 mapping.put("genre", genreFieldTypeMap);

 response = weDeploy.data(DATA_URL)
      .createCollection("movies", movieMap)
      .execute();
        Parameters:
        name - Collection name.
        mapping - Map field names to their types.
        Returns:
        Call

      • createCollection

        public Call<Response> createCollection(Collection collection)
        Creates a collection and maps the field types. The data CollectionFieldMap contains the field names and their types CollectionFieldType. The mapping can also contains nested CollectionFieldMap. 

        
 WeDeployData data = weDeploy.data("http://demodata.wedeploy.io");

 CollectionFieldMap genreFieldTypeMap = new CollectionFieldMap();
 innerCollection.put("name", CollectionFieldType.STRING);
 innerCollection.put("description", CollectionFieldType.STRING);

 CollectionFieldMap movieMap = new CollectionFieldMap();
 mapping.put("title", CollectionFieldType.STRING);
 mapping.put("genre", genreFieldTypeMap);

 Collection collection = new Collection("movies", movieMap);

 response = weDeploy.data(DATA_URL)
      .createCollection(collection)
      .execute();
        Parameters:
        collection - Collection object.
        Returns:
        Call

      • update

        public Call<Response> update(java.lang.String key,
                             JSONObject data)
        Updates the attributes of a document based on the passed-in JSONObject and saves the record. 

        
 WeDeployData data = weDeploy.data("http://demodata.wedeploy.io");

 JSONObject movieJsonObject = new JSONObject()
      .put("title", "Star Wars: Episode I");

 data.update("movies/1019112353", movieJsonObject)
      .execute();
        Parameters:
        key - used to update the document.
        data - Attributes on the object that is to be updated.
        Returns:
        Call

      • updateCollection

        public Call<Response> updateCollection(java.lang.String name,
                                       CollectionFieldMap mapping)
        Updates the mapped field types of a collection. The data CollectionFieldMap contains the field names and their types CollectionFieldType. The mapping can also contains nested CollectionFieldMap and can't be empty. Existing fields cannot be remapped to a different type. 

        
 WeDeployData data = weDeploy.data("http://demodata.wedeploy.io");

 CollectionFieldMap genreFieldTypeMap = new CollectionFieldMap();
 innerCollection.put("name", CollectionFieldType.STRING);
 innerCollection.put("description", CollectionFieldType.STRING);

 CollectionFieldMap movieMap = new CollectionFieldMap();
 mapping.put("title", CollectionFieldType.STRING);
 mapping.put("genre", genreFieldTypeMap);

 response = weDeploy.data(DATA_URL)
      .createCollection("movies", movieMap)
      .execute();
        Parameters:
        name - Collection name.
        mapping - Map field names to their types.
        Returns:
        Call

      • updateCollection

        public Call<Response> updateCollection(Collection collection)
        Updates the mapped field types of a collection. The data CollectionFieldMap contains the field names and their types CollectionFieldType. The mapping can also contains nested CollectionFieldMap and can't be empty. Existing fields cannot be remapped to a different type. 

        
 WeDeployData data = weDeploy.data("http://demodata.wedeploy.io");

 CollectionFieldMap genreFieldTypeMap = new CollectionFieldMap();
 innerCollection.put("name", CollectionFieldType.STRING);
 innerCollection.put("description", CollectionFieldType.STRING);

 CollectionFieldMap movieMap = new CollectionFieldMap();
 mapping.put("title", CollectionFieldType.STRING);
 mapping.put("genre", genreFieldTypeMap);

 Collection collection = new Collection("movies", movieMap);

 response = weDeploy.data(DATA_URL)
      .createCollection(collection)
      .execute();
        Parameters:
        collection - Collection object.
        Returns:
        Call

      • replace

        public Call<Response> replace(java.lang.String key,
                              JSONObject data)
        Replaces the attributes of a document based on the passed-in JSONObject and saves the record. 

        
 WeDeployData data = weDeploy.data("http://demodata.wedeploy.io");

 JSONObject movieJsonObject = new JSONObject()
      .put("title", "Star Wars: Episode I");

 data.replace("movies/1019112353", movieJsonObject)
      .execute();
        Parameters:
        key - used to update the document.
        data - Attributes on the object that is to be replaced.
        Returns:
        Call
